intro: Critesion, commonly known as the goldenrod, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its showy, yellow or golden flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. The plant typically grows in a variety of habitats, including meadows, prairies, and disturbed soils. Critesion species are often found in North America and are known for their ability to thrive in full sun. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem.
